message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We use a combination of survey data from the 2015-16 national family health survey, along with administrative data from the national health mission", "dataset": ["2015-16 national family health survey", "national health mission"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This study analyzes data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys conducted between 2006 and 2019 in Latin American countries", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Using a dataset of satellite observations from the Landsat archive and deforestation data from the Brazilian National Institute for Space Research (INPE), we found that agricultural expansion is responsible for up to 80% of recent deforestation in Brazil", "dataset": ["Landsat archive", "Brazilian National Institute for Space Research (INPE)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We used data from the Gallup World Poll conducted between 2009 and 2018, as well as data on gender equality from the World Economic Forum's Global Gender Gap Report", "dataset": ["Gallup World Poll", "World Economic Forum's Global Gender Gap Report"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "To analyze the impact of infrastructure on economic growth and productivity, we utilized cross-country panel data from the World Bank's Private Participation in Infrastructure Database and the World Development Indicators", "dataset": ["World Bank's Private Participation in Infrastructure Database", "World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We combined data from the Charities Aid Foundation's World Giving Index, the United Nations' Human Development Index, and the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development's Social Expenditure Database to explore the relationship between social spending and charitable giving", "dataset": ["Charities Aid Foundation's World Giving Index", "United Nations' Human Development Index", "Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development's Social Expenditure Database"], "topic": ["Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using a dataset of bilateral trade flows from the International Trade Centre and data on transport infrastructure from the World Bank's Logistics Performance Index, we examine the impact of transportation infrastructure on international trade", "dataset": ["International Trade Centre", "World Bank's Logistics Performance Index"], "topic": ["Transport", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We utilized household survey data from the World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study to study the impacts of climate change on individual welfare and consumption patterns in Sub-Saharan Africa", "dataset": ["World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study"], "topic": ["Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines the relationship between public debt and economic growth using a dataset of public debt levels from the International Monetary Fund's Fiscal Monitor and gross domestic product data from the World Bank's World Development Indicators", "dataset": ["International Monetary Fund's Fiscal Monitor", "World Bank's World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Debt", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "To analyze labor market dynamics, we combine panel data on firms from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys with household-level survey data from the Integrated Labour Force Survey conducted by the Uganda Bureau of Statistics", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Integrated Labour Force Survey conducted by the Uganda Bureau of Statistics"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We use a combination of survey data from the 2015-16 national family health survey, along with administrative data from the national health mission", "dataset": ["2015-16 deforestation data from the Brazilian National Institute for Space Research (INPE), we found that agricultural expansion is responsible for up to 80% of recent deforestation in Brazil", "dataset": "Integrated Labour Force Survey conducted by the Uganda Bureau of Statistics"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}]
